game_overview: Food Chain Magnate is a heavy strategy game about building a fast food chain. Players compete on a variable city map through purchasing, marketing and sales, and on a job market for key staff members. The focus is on building your company using a card-driven (human) resource management system. Each player starts as a single entrepreneur and builds up a fast food chain by hiring and training staff, represented by cards, and by running the operations of their company, which is done on a variable board. The game continues until the bank runs out of money twice. The richest player then wins.
objective: Accumulate the most cash by the time the bank breaks for the second time.

components_overview.name: Turn Order Track
components_overview.description: Track for determining player order each turn

components_overview.name: Map Tiles
components_overview.description: Map elements that create the variable city board. Each tile is 5x5 squares and can contain roads, drinks, houses, or empty space.
components_overview.detailed_description: Map tiles are physical tile components consisting of 5x5 squares. Initially, a square can contain a road, drinks, part of a house, or empty space.

components_overview.name: House Tiles
components_overview.description: Tiles representing houses where customers live

components_overview.name: Garden Tiles
components_overview.description: Tiles that can be added to houses to increase their value
components_overview.detailed_description: Gardens are placed adjacent to houses over 2 squares to form a 2x3 rectangle. Houses with gardens double the unit price received for each item sold.

components_overview.name: Billboard Marketing Tiles
components_overview.description: Marketing campaigns placed adjacent to roads
components_overview.detailed_description: Billboards reach all houses orthogonally adjacent to them. Must be placed adjacent to roads.

components_overview.name: Mailbox Marketing Tiles
components_overview.description: Marketing campaigns that reach entire blocks
components_overview.detailed_description: Mailboxes reach all houses in the same block (area enclosed by roads). Must be placed adjacent to roads.

components_overview.name: Airplane Marketing Tiles
components_overview.description: Marketing campaigns placed on board edges
components_overview.detailed_description: Airplanes reach every house in a line of 1, 3, or 5 rows or columns. Must be placed on the side of the board.

components_overview.name: Radio Marketing Tiles
components_overview.description: Marketing campaigns that reach multiple tiles
components_overview.detailed_description: Radio campaigns reach every house on the tile where placed and all 8 surrounding tiles. Must be placed adjacent to roads.

components_overview.name: Numbered Busy Chips
components_overview.description: Tokens indicating how long a marketeer will be busy
components_overview.detailed_description: Placed on marketeer cards when they initiate campaigns. The number corresponds to campaign duration.

components_overview.name: Restaurants
components_overview.description: Restaurant buildings for each player chain (2x2 squares with entrance marked)
components_overview.detailed_description: Restaurants must be placed on empty squares with entrance adjacent to a road. Regional/Local managers give restaurants drive-in capability (entrances in each corner).

components_overview.name: Employee Cards
components_overview.description: Cards depicting people who work in the company with various abilities
components_overview.detailed_description: Employee cards show a person and their abilities. Cards with ● in top left can be hired by recruiters. Cards with $ require salary. Training options shown in bottom left. Cards marked ◆ are top positions (only one per player). Some cards show range on top right.

components_overview.name: Milestone Cards
components_overview.description: Achievement cards that provide permanent bonuses
components_overview.detailed_description: Awarded when specific achievements are met. Provide various bonuses for the rest of the game. Multiple players can claim the same milestone in the same turn.

components_overview.name: Bank Reserve Cards
components_overview.description: Cards showing money to be added when bank breaks
components_overview.detailed_description: Players choose one at setup (face down). When bank breaks first time, these are revealed and money added to bank. Also determines CEO slot count.

components_overview.name: CEO Cards
components_overview.description: The CEO card that leads each company
components_overview.detailed_description: Always at work. Can have 3 subordinates (or 2-10 based on reserve cards). Provides one free recruitment action. Can become CFO with milestone.

components_overview.name: Paper Money Bills
components_overview.description: Money used for transactions and victory
components_overview.detailed_description: Bank starts with $50 per player. Additional money added when reserve cards opened.

components_overview.name: Softdrinks
components_overview.description: Wooden drink tokens representing softdrinks
components_overview.detailed_description: Used as demand markers on houses, advertising markers on campaigns, and stock in player areas.

setup.description: Lay out the employee and milestone cards according to the reference image. For each employee card marked with ●, remove cards based on player count.
Remove 1 copy of each ● employee card. Remove employee cards #15 and #16.
Remove 2 copies of each ● employee card. Remove employee card #16.
Remove 3 copies of each ● employee card.
Put billboards #12, #15, and #16 back in the box.
Put billboards #15 and #16 back in the box.
Put billboard #16 back in the box.
Create a 3x3 map by randomly selecting 9 map tiles. Rotate each tile randomly before placing in a grid.
Create a 3x4 map by randomly selecting 12 map tiles. Rotate each tile randomly before placing in a grid.
Create a 4x4 map by randomly selecting 16 map tiles. Rotate each tile randomly before placing in a grid.
Create a 5x4 map by randomly selecting 20 map tiles. Rotate each tile randomly before placing in a grid.
Place $50 per player into the bank pool using practical (small) bills. Put the rest back in the box.
Each player chooses a restaurant chain and receives a CEO card, 3 restaurants, and a set of 3 bank reserve cards.
Collect turn order markers of chosen chains, shuffle them, and randomly place them on the turn order track in drawn order.

Starting with the last player in turn order and ending with the first, each player may either place a restaurant or pass. If anyone passed, do a second round in turn order where remaining players must place.
Each player chooses one of their three bank reserve cards and places it face down next to the bank. Discard the other two unseen.

gameplay.turn_structure: The game is played in 7 phases, some simultaneous and some in turn order. Phases are: 1) Restructuring (simultaneous), 2) Order of Business (based on open slots), 3) Working 9:00-5:00 (turn order), 4) Dinnertime (house number order), 5) Payday (simultaneous), 6) Marketing Campaigns (campaign number order), 7) Clean Up (simultaneous).

actions.name: Phase 1: Restructuring
actions.description: Players choose which employees to use this turn and arrange them into a company structure with the CEO at the top.

steps.description: Each player simultaneously chooses which employee cards to use this turn and places them face down. All other cards are placed face down in a separate pile.
All players simultaneously reveal the pile of cards to be used this turn. These employees are 'at work'. The rest are 'on the beach'.
Place the cards at work into a pyramid company structure. CEO at top, managers below CEO (up to 3), and normal employees below managers (2-10 per manager).
If too many cards were played to fit the structure, all cards except CEO go on the beach and the player plays with only the CEO.

notes.description: The CEO is always at work and always the top of the pyramid
During all other phases, players can request to see another player's cards (both at work and on beach)

actions.name: Phase 2: Order of Business
actions.description: Players choose their position on the turn order track based on open slots in their company structure.

steps.description: Count open slots (unused slots on CEO and managers). Player with 'First airplane campaign' milestone adds 2 extra open slots.
Player with most open slots chooses turn order position first. Ties broken by previous turn order (earlier player chooses first).
Continue in descending order of open slots until all players have chosen positions.

actions.name: Phase 3: Working 9:00-5:00
actions.description: Players take turns performing actions for each card in their company structure. Actions must be performed in the order listed in the rules.

steps.description: Players take turns in turn order. Each player completes all their actions before the next player begins.

Recruit: CEO provides 1 free recruitment. Additional recruitments from recruiting girl (1x), recruiting manager (2x), or HR director (4x). Hire entry-level (●) employees to the beach. Can hire if immediately training to higher level.

Train: For each training action (trainer, coach, guru), train one employee on the beach one step. Cannot train cards at work or busy marketeers. Coach can train same card 2 steps, guru 3 steps. With milestone, multiple trainers can train same card.

Initiate Marketing Campaigns: For each marketeer at work, place a campaign (billboard/mailbox/airplane/radio) within range (if applicable). Choose what to advertise (pizza/burger/drink type). Place wooden pieces equal to duration on campaign. Place busy chip on marketeer card.

Get Food & Drinks: Kitchen staff and buyers collect food/drinks per their card abilities. Kitchen trainee: 1 burger or pizza. Burger cook: 3 burgers. Burger chef: 8 burgers. Pizza cook: 3 pizzas. Pizza chef: 8 pizzas. Errand boy: 1 drink of any type. Cart operator: 2 drinks per source, range 2. Truck driver: 3 drinks per source, range 3. Zeppelin pilot: 2 drinks per source, range 4, ignore roads.
Place New Houses/Gardens: New business developer can place a new house connected to a road anywhere on the map, or add a garden (2x3 rectangle) to an existing house on empty squares.

Place/Move Restaurants: Local manager places new restaurant within range 3 by road, entrance connects to road, placed 'COMING SOON'. Regional manager places restaurant anywhere entrance connects to road, or moves existing restaurant, active immediately. Both provide drive-in (entrances in all corners).

notes.description: Actions of pricing manager, discount manager, luxury manager, CFO, recruiting manager, HR director, and waitress are mandatory
Actions must be performed in the order listed, regardless of organizational chart position
Only one copy of each ◆ card allowed per player

actions.name: Phase 4: Dinnertime
actions.description: Houses eat based on demand tokens, choosing restaurants by price and distance. Players earn money for sales.

steps.description: Process houses in order of printed house numbers (lowest first).
For each house with demand tokens: find chains with restaurants connected by road that can provide ALL demanded goods. If none, inhabitants stay home.

If multiple chains can supply: calculate unit price (base $10, +/- price managers). Calculate distance (range from house to nearest restaurant entrance). Add (unit price + distance). Lowest sum wins. Ties broken by most waitresses, then turn order.

Winning chain serves food: remove demand tokens and matching goods from stock. Earn unit price + milestone bonuses per item. Houses with gardens: earn 2x unit price (bonuses not doubled). Then add bonuses.
After all houses processed: each chain earns $3 per waitress ($5 with milestone).
Chains with CFO (or milestone): earn +50% bonus on all cash earned this turn (including waitress tips), rounded up.
If bank has insufficient funds, break the bank (first time: open reserve cards, add money, adjust CEO slots; second time: game ends, finish phase 4, most cash wins).

notes.description: Bonuses from milestones (e.g., +$5 for burgers) do not affect unit price for competition calculation
Standard unit price is $10 before any modifiers

actions.name: Phase 5: Payday
actions.description: Players may fire employees and must pay salaries for cards with $ symbol.

steps.description: Each player may fire any employees in company structure or on the beach. Return fired cards to general stock. Busy marketeers normally cannot be fired.
Pay $5 for each card with $ symbol in structure or on beach, including busy marketeers. Unused recruiting manager/HR director actions give $5 discount each. Apply all discounts. Minimum payment $0.
If a player has no money but must pay a busy marketeer, that marketeer must be fired (only if all other salaried employees already fired). Campaign remains on board.

notes.description: First billboard placed milestone: marketeers require no salary
First to train someone milestone: $15 salary discount

actions.name: Phase 6: Marketing Campaigns
actions.description: Marketing campaigns run in number order, placing demand tokens on houses they reach.

steps.description: Process campaigns in order of printed campaign numbers (lowest first).
Billboard: place 1 demand token of advertised type on each house orthogonally adjacent (including garden-only adjacency).
Mailbox: place 1 demand token on each house in the same block (area enclosed by roads and board edge).
Airplane: place 1 demand token on each house in a line of 1/3/5 rows or columns from the airplane.
Radio: place 1 demand token on each house on the radio's tile and all 8 surrounding tiles (2 tokens with milestone).
Houses have maximum 3 demand tokens (5 with garden). Campaigns have no effect on full houses.
After campaign runs: remove 1 advertising token from campaign. If no tokens remain, return campaign to stock and return marketeer to player (unless eternal campaign).

notes.description: First billboard placed milestone: campaigns are eternal (never end, marketeer unavailable forever)
First radio campaign milestone: radios place 2 demand tokens instead of 1

actions.name: Phase 7: Clean Up
actions.description: Discard unused goods, collect cards, flip new restaurants, and remove claimed milestones.

steps.description: All players without 'First to throw away drink/food' milestone discard all food and drinks they own. With milestone, keep up to 10 in freezer.
All cards from company structure and beach are taken back into hand. Other players may request to see them.
Flip all 'COMING SOON' restaurants to 'WELCOME' side (they become active).
If any milestones were awarded this turn, turn all remaining milestone cards of the same type upside down (no longer available).
Advertising tokens on campaigns and demand tokens on houses remain on the board.

end_game.trigger: The game ends when the bank breaks for the second time (cannot pay all income in Phase 4).
procedure: Finish Phase 4 (Dinnertime) completely, paying all earnings even if bank is insufficient (write down IOUs if needed).
Do not proceed to Phase 5 (Payday) - no salaries are paid this turn.

final_scoring.description: All money earned throughout the game, including final turn

winning_condition: The player with the most cash wins. In case of a tie, the tied player who is earlier in turn order wins.
